result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda Marie Kleidon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amanda Marie Kleidon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amanda Marie Kleidon was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Count 3 in 13CM708.
Court dismisses Counts 1 and 2.
Defendant to report to Probation today July 27, 2015.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Court does not object to Probation being transferred to Minnesota.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation for Count 3 in 14CF222, but not Count 3 in 13CM708.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: to Count 3 13CM708

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Amanda Marie Kleidon appeared.  Court called at 9:08 a.m.  Includes case 14CF222 & 13CM708.  State files an Amended Information.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.   DE needs conference with attorney.  Recess at 9:17 a.m.  Case recalled at 9:35 a.m.  Attorney Harrelson questions the DE for the court record.  Court questions the DE.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to the amended Ct 3 in 14CF222.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 3 in 14CF222.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 3 in 13CM708. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct. 3 in 13CM708.   On motion of the State, Crt dismisses amended Ct 1  & amended Ct 2 in 14CF222 and Ct. 1 & Ct. 2 in 13CM708. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 3 in 14CF222 to run concurrent with Ct. 3 in 13CM708
S/W 2 years probation with conditions 
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA with follow through and any recommended treatment
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250 for Ct. 3 in 14CF222 not to run concurrent with Ct. 3 in 13CM708
- Court costs to be paid through the DOC

Ct. 3 in 13CM708 to run concurrent with Ct. 3 in 14CF222
S/W 1 year probation with conditions
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA with follow through and any recommended treatment
- Court costs of $243.00 for Ct. 3 in 13CM708 not to run concurrent with Ct. 3 in 14CF222  
- Court costs to be paid through the DOC

- Court does not object to probation being transferred to Minnesota
- DE can apply for expungement on completion of probation for Ct. 3 in 14CF222 but not Ct. 3 in 13CM708
- DE to report to probation today 07/27/2015
- Bail is continued until the DE signs up for probation and then is vacated
- 20 days to appeal
Filed by ADA Nieskes. km
Filed by ADA Nieskes. km
Filed by ADA Nieskes. km
